title: Hyundai i20 automatic is now Rs 58,000 cheaper
description: The Hyundai i20 automatic starting price is Rs 58,000 lower as the Korean brand has introduced the CVT automatic on the second-from-bottom Magna variant. Hyundai has also launched the i20 Magna Executive at a lower price point than the Magna, and added more features to the higher-spec Sportz (O) variant. Hyundai i20 CVT Magna variant priced at Rs 8.89 lakh Hyundai i20 Magna Executive priced Rs 27,000 lower than Magna MT Hyundai i20 Sportz (O) with more features priced up to Rs 26,000 higher 2025 Hyundai i20 prices, ex-showroom, India (in Rs, lakh)VariantNew priceOld priceDifferenceEra-7.04-Magna Executive7.51--Magna-7.79-Sportz*-8.42-Magna CVT8.89--Sportz (O)*9.058.790.26Asta*-9.38-Sportz CVT*-9.47-Sportz (O) CVT*10.009.820.18Asta (O)-10.00-Asta (O) CVT-10.00- *Dual-tone option costs Rs 15,000 extra Hyundai i20 Magna CVT launched Magna CVT adds sunroof over Magna MT variant The CVT automatic option for the Hyundai i20 was previously available from the higher-spec Sportz variant (Rs 9.46 lakh) onwards. With the introduction of the Magna CVT that price has come down to Rs 8,89 lakh. In addition to the features available on the Magna manual variant, the automatic also gets a sunroof. Hyundai i20 Magna Executive launched Same features as Magna MT variant Only available with the 5-speed manual gearbox, the i20 Magna Executive costs Rs 27,000 less than the Magna MT variant. Despite the price difference, the new variant has the same features list as the i20 Magna, as Hyundai is looking to make the premium hatchback more accessible. As Hyundai India's COO Tarun Garg says, “With the launch of the Magna Executive variant, we aim to make the i20 experience even more accessible and desirable for customers.” Hyundai i20 Sportz (O) price and features Keyless entry, a voice-enabled sunroof, and a 7-speaker Bose system added to Sportz (O) Hyundai has also taken this opportunity to introduce more features in the i20 Sportz(O) variant. With kit such as keyless entry and go, a voice-enabled sunroof, and a 7-speaker Bose audio system, prices for the Hyundai i20 Sportz (O) have increased by up to Rs 26,000. Further, the Korean brand is offering a 10-inch touchscreen infotainment – with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay – and a rear camera as optional extras for Rs 14,999 on the entire i20 range. These accessories come with a 3-year warranty. Hyundai has launched a CVT-equipped Magna variant, introduced a Magna Executive variant and added more features on the higher-spec Sportz (O) trim.

The Hyundai i20 automatic starting price is Rs 58,000 lower as the Korean brand has introduced the CVT automatic on the second-from-bottom Magna variant. Hyundai has also launched the i20 Magna Executive at a lower price point than the Magna, and added more features to the higher-spec Sportz (O) variant.

  1. Hyundai i20 CVT Magna variant priced at Rs 8.89 lakh
  2. Hyundai i20 Magna Executive priced Rs 27,000 lower than Magna MT
  3. Hyundai i20 Sportz (O) with more features priced up to Rs 26,000 higher

Hyundai i20 Magna CVT launched

Magna CVT adds sunroof over Magna MT variant

The CVT automatic option for the Hyundai i20 was previously available from the higher-spec Sportz variant (Rs 9.46 lakh) onwards. With the introduction of the Magna CVT that price has come down to Rs 8,89 lakh. In addition to the features available on the Magna manual variant, the automatic also gets a sunroof.

Hyundai i20 Magna Executive launched

Same features as Magna MT variant

Only available with the 5-speed manual gearbox, the i20 Magna Executive costs Rs 27,000 less than the Magna MT variant. Despite the price difference, the new variant has the same features list as the i20 Magna, as Hyundai is looking to make the premium hatchback more accessible. As Hyundai India's COO Tarun Garg says, “With the launch of the Magna Executive variant, we aim to make the i20 experience even more accessible and desirable for customers.”

Hyundai i20 Sportz (O) price and features

Keyless entry, a voice-enabled sunroof, and a 7-speaker Bose system added to Sportz (O)

Hyundai has also taken this opportunity to introduce more features in the i20 Sportz(O) variant. With kit such as keyless entry and go, a voice-enabled sunroof, and a 7-speaker Bose audio system, prices for the Hyundai i20 Sportz (O) have increased by up to Rs 26,000.

Further, the Korean brand is offering a 10-inch touchscreen infotainment – with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay – and a rear camera as optional extras for Rs 14,999 on the entire i20 range. These accessories come with a 3-year warranty.
